newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's Pan Ocean sees $2 bln turnover in 2000.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's Pan Ocean sees $2 bln turnover in 2000.

text.p: Pan Ocean Shipping Co Ltd, South Korea's third largest shipping company, said on Thursday its turnover would rise to $2 billion in 2000 from the current $1 billion.
"Annual average growth rate for turnover would be 18 percent by 2000 and reach $2 billion in 2000," a company spokesman said.
Its deadweight tonnage would rise 21 percent to 3.98 million tonnes with 80 carriers in 2000 from the current 3.33 million tonnes with 66 carriers, the spokesman said.
Pan Ocean planned to invest $1.1 billion by 2000 to purchase 40 new carriers and replace old carriers by them, he said.
According to the Korea Shipowners' Association, South Korea's total deadweight tonnage is estimated at 11 million tonne this year.
